file_content.text: When this is all over, you're getting a statue in Sobrik.
It's over. Sobrik is free. I didn't think I'd live to see it.
You have no idea what you've done for us. Colonel Marric's sacrifice inspired countless men to join the resistance.
The Republic's promised more men, more supplies. We'll clean things up in Sobrik, and then see what else we can do.
I couldn't think of a better legacy for Colonel Marric.
That's the best revenge.
Too bad the colonel's not here to see it.
That's the best revenge.
War changes everyone. I'm just glad it only turned one of us into a traitor.
You farmers aren't half-bad in a fight.
Keep up the good work.
The harder we fight, the sooner the Empire will leave.
Don't forget my statue.
Your name will be in the history books some day; I can promise you that.
It doesn't bother you that Balmorra's hope is built on a lie?
You've deceived everyone.
Colonel Marric was the traitor, not me. If a little white lie helps us this much, I'm willing to tell more.
Commander Madine wants to speak with you. We've got him waiting on comm call.
Did the commander say what it was about?
Any reason why?
He didn't say, and I didn't pry.
Understood.
Understood.
He should learn to fight his own battles.
Not him again.
After seeing you in action, I can't really blame him.
Balmorra will never forget what you did for us. Thank you again.
Of course, all the talk is about a Balmorran hero turned Imperial. We look like idiots. There'll be desertions.
Colonel Marric's rotting away in a secure storage room. Once the Empire's gone, he'll get a proper jail cell.
A lot of Balmorrans died today. Colonel Marric would have been one too many.
We had enough bodies.
When Colonel Marric realizes his error, it'll do more for Balmorra than his death ever could.
Maybe he'll come around.
War isn't all glory and medals. There are some tough calls.
This is being a leader.
Traitors make me angry too, but they don't learn anything dead.
That's what he deserves.
I can't really fault you for doing what you thought was right.
Sobrik's free, isn't it?
If I hear the colonel died anyway, I'm going to be very upset.
He better make it there.
I'm not a murderer. But I'll see that he gets the punishment he deserves.
Winning Sobrik didn't go exactly as planned. But with the city free, people will know it's only a matter of time before they're free, too.
Sobrik will be free, and Balmorra will have hope.
Then, if we can hit the power--ah, looks like you've got your reinforcements.
A whole squad? I see why the Republic's help is worth the wait.
Master Jedi. I'm honored you're willing to take up our cause.
Captain! Remind me to ask the Republic for help more often.
A mercenary. Whether you're in it for the credits or the cause, I'm glad to have you.
I knew the Republic would send someone.
I'm Beke Talrott, and this is Colonel Marric. We welcome anyone who's willing to fight for a free Balmorra.
I requested backup because we've set our sights on the city of Sobrik. It's currently Imperial headquarters.
What happened to Sobrik's citizens?
How did they manage that?
The Empire destroyed everything Balmorran and covered the city with their blasted red banners.
Why not protect your families and homes first?
Why risk your lives like this?
When we force the Empire out of Sobrik, Balmorra can look to it as a sign that this occupation will end.
The average Balmorran isn't exactly equipped for that.
Your sights are pretty high.
Just what I said. Beke should leave the fighting to the professionals, like you and me.
You got a lot of volunteers for something that could be suicide.
Brave bunch you've got here.
The Empire's razed our land, forced us from our homes, taken our cities... we do what we must.
What's your secret weapon?
I'm in this for the money.
Balmorra is more than profit and weapons and factories. We've got culture, history and heroes, too.
Colonel Marric is the most decorated officer in the Balmorran militia and our man inside the Empire.
Our best bet into Sobrik is an aerial assault--landing in the spaceport and surprising them.
Our transport's an old Republic model. She can carry enough men to challenge the Empire.
But the spaceport shield disables any non-Imperial craft, and all the false promises in the galaxy won't deactivate it.
Balmorra's not a safe place to fly.
That's some shield.
When you're welcome, it's safe enough. When you're not... well, you can see why everyone's fighting over it.
What's wrong with storming the gates?
We could just walk.
You couldn't win, not without the spaceport. The Empire could hole themselves up in there and launch fighter after fighter.
We've gotten our hands on the Troida Disruptor, a prototype weapon that could break through Sobrik's shield.
The Empire has failsafes in place, and the Troida Disruptor will only work for a few minutes. Luckily, that's all we need.
But activating it requires enough power to launch a star destroyer, and we don't have it.
The only thing that's got that kind of juice is Sobrik's power grid, the largest set of generators on Balmorra.
You've seen one generator, you've seen them all, right?
Sounds simple enough.
Tampering with these generators might get some unwanted attention.
Won't the Empire notice?
The men will be armed for the assault on Sobrik. If the Empire decides to bring a fight here first, we'll be ready.
You must have one soldier or technician in this resistance.
I don't do maintenance.
Most have never held a blaster in their life. Our only advantage in Sobrik is numbers, and our only way inside is you.
Now, the Empire, anticipating an attack, has positioned fully armed garrisons at each generator.
If you can get past them and siphon power from the generators, we can activate the Troida Disruptor and break through Sobrik's shield.
Ready your men. I'll have that power when you need it.
You can rely on me.
Make sure your men are prepared. The Empire's no pushover.
Be ready for action.
We've been waiting for this day ever since the Empire invaded. We'll be ready.
I'm good at getting things where they need to go.
Sounds right up my alley.
Beneath me, but okay.
Don't get cocky. The Empire had you blockaded not too long ago.
I'll monitor the power grid from here and contact you when everything's in place. Good luck.
I can't commit to a battle just yet.
It can wait. [Refuse quest]
We've given this everything we've got. Balmorra will never be free unless you help us.
Has anyone gotten word from Bugtown? Can the Republic spare anyone?
So what will?
